name: US State Borders Quiz | USA | 15 Questions

questions.text: What two states' border is partially formed by the Continental Divide?
questions.explanation:
idaho montana & montana idaho.

	Montana is the state furthest west that's on the eastern side of the Continental Divide.

questions.text: What state's border claims territory in 4 of the 5 Great Lakes?
questions.explanation:
Michigan.

	It claims about half of Lakes Superior, Michigan (surprise), Huron, and just a tiny bit of Lake Erie.

questions.text: What state's borders are NOT made of only straight lines?
questions.explanation:
New Mexico.

	Part of the NM-Texas border is formed by the Rio Grande.

questions.text: What state's southern border is formed by a river of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	Texas' southern border is the Rio Grande, Oklahoma's is the Red River, and Maryland's is the Potomac River.

questions.text: (For questions 5 and 6, states away from an international border state means how many adjacent states must be moved to to get to a state on an international border, including both the beginning and ending state. E.g., Oregon would be two away: Oregon and Washington.) What two states are the furthest from international border states, at 5 states away?
questions.correct: Florida South Carolina & South Carolina Florida
questions.explanation:
Florida South Carolina & South Carolina Florida.

	Georgia, in-between Florida and South Carolina, is closer because it borders Tennessee.

questions.text: What three non-international border states are only 2 away from both Canada and Mexico?
questions.correct: Nevada Utah Oregon & Nevada Oregon Utah & Utah Nevada Oregon & Utah Oregon Nevada & Oregon Nevada Utah & Oregon Utah Nevada
questions.explanation:
Nevada Utah Oregon & Nevada Oregon Utah & Utah Nevada Oregon & Utah Oregon Nevada & Oregon Nevada Utah & Oregon Utah Nevada.

	Only in the west, where the states are big enough to span great distances.

questions.text: What two Canadian provinces only border 1 US State?
questions.correct: Alberta New Brunswick & New Brunswick Alberta
questions.explanation:
Alberta New Brunswick & New Brunswick Alberta.

	Betcha some of you said 'Yukon'.  However, it's not a province, but a territory.

questions.text: What Canadian province borders the most US States?
questions.explanation:
Ontario.

	It borders 5: Minnesota, Michigan, Ohio, Pennsylvania, and New York. Quebec and BC tie at 4 (Q: New York, Vermont, New Hampshire, {Maine;} BC: Alaska, Washington, Idaho, Montana). Newfoundland does not border the US.

questions.text: Of the 48 contiguous states, which is the furthest north ?
questions.explanation:
Minnesota.

	Part of a peninsula in Lake of the Woods is part of Minnesota, even though land access to it is only from Manitoba, Canada. Point Roberts, WA, is {similar;} its only land access is through British Columbia, Canada.

questions.text: One of two states that borders 8 other states.
questions.explanation:
Missouri & Tennessee.

	Colorado comes close with 6 (or 7, if you count Arizona).

questions.text: This state only borders one other state.
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	All the other choices in this question border two other states.

questions.text: What states have an arc (segment of a circle) as part of their border?
questions.explanation:
Delaware and Pennsylvania.

	Much of Delaware's border with Pennsylvania.

questions.text: Which state's border isn't defined by the Missouri River at all?
Which of the 48 contiguous states is 3rd-furthest south?
questions.explanation:
Louisiana.

	The Mississippi River Delta is the southern-most point in Lousisana. Florida is furthest, Texas is 2nd, and California ia 10th (!), behind Florida, Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, Arizona, New Mexico, and South Carolina.

questions.text: Starting from Miami, FL, and going straight north, where would you cross the Canadian border?
questions.correct: In Lake Erie, NNW of Erie, PA
options: In Lake Ontario, N of Rochester, NY
At the NY-Quebec border, 30 miles S of Montreal
questions.explanation:
In Lake Erie, NNW of Erie, PA.

	You'd travel through the Atlantic first, then make landfall, then cut through Pennsylvania before crossing the border.
